intro: Galactia brevistyla, commonly known as the short-styled milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Galactia brevistyla is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of desert flora.
